text: Bottle from Burg Bieren, bottled 27JUN16 BB 27JUN17, 33 cl sample. Hazy dark golden color, medium rocky head. Aroma of peppery yeast, onion and garlic (like a lot of belgian IPAs smell), slight cheesy. Soft citrussy bitterness, sharp and dry peppery note. For a belgian IPA, its not that bad, but the style is just so bad: the low fg plus the peppery spice from the yeast simply doesnt match with harsh citrusy bitterness. You need body for that.
Upon further tasting the Belgian-style yeast and malt is at least noticeable, but it¬ís an Anglosphere IPA and the aromatic hops hit hard, making the rest unenjoyable (11.2 oz bottle, Tallinn)

Noterar att den smakar banan. Med det kunde r√§tteg√•ngen vara √∂ver: "Till galgbacken!" Men icke, det h√§r √∂let m√• ha gjort sig skyldigt till en grov sk√§ndlighet, men sonar det med ett ymnighetshorn av smaker som vittnar om ett i grunden gott upps√•t. D√∂m inte √∂let efter bananen.

Has that nice Buxton feel but doesn¬ít completely deliver. Too Belgian, not enough Anglo.
At Seven Seasons in Hoxton
Bottle. Duvel like. Boozy, feels too full on for 6.8. Like an abbey triple. Don¬ít mind it but it feels like a hangover coming.

Au top! "

Oui ! Dans mes tops direct.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper clear, massive beige head. Smell of spices, herbs, belgian yeast esters, complex and inviting, earthy, nice malts. Light to moderate sweet, herbal, spicy, nice fruity tendensies, very nice flavor palette. Medium bitter, earthy and spicy tail
Luktar citrus och j√§st. Gulorange l√§tt molnig med mycket skum som l√§gger sig. Ganska b√§sk, men god.

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a clear straw colour with a frothy white head and some clingy lace. The aroma is big Belgian yeast, light toffee caramel, some alcohol. The flavour is moderate bitter sweet with a dry crisp, light, refreshing, yeasty, malt alcoholic palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A Duvel light with a little more malt. Excellent actually and tastes stronger than the ABV suggests.

Hazy straw colour / orange, soapy white head and circular lacing. Aroma is hoppy (floral, citrus) besides the typical Belgian yeasty nose. Taste is closer to a belgian ale than an IPA, but besides its malty character, honey and candi sugar, it gets a nice floral and citrusy hoppiness. Quite a pleasant and refreshing (for a Belgian) ale. Nice blend.

Bottle from Prohibition Wines. Golden colour with a frothy white head. Strong malt character with a pronounced caramel flavour. Lots of hop character, with hints of orange, grapefruit, pine and spices. Some bubblegum-like flavour from the use of Belgian yeasts, giving this beer more of a Belgian Strong Ale taste than that of a regular IPA. A little boozy in flavour, but highly drinkable and absolutely delicious.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. TCBW. ≈öwietna praca dro≈ºd≈ºy, bardzo dobry przyk≈Çad Belgian IPA.

Aroma: floral, citrus, spruce, 
Apperance: golden, clear, frothy, 
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, oily feel, lively,
L√§tt disig orange √∂l med ett l√§ttare skum. Doft av torkad frukt, frukt, malt och kryddig j√§stighet. I smaken drar fruktigheten √•t citrush√•llet.

Laranja escuro de leve turbidez, espuma branca abundante de m√©dia/longa persist√™ncia, irregular. Aroma alaranjado e leveduras belgas, tropical frutado com toques de especiarias e nada de caramelo. Paladar de amargor m√©dio e leve dul√ßor. Corpo e carbonata√ß√£o m√©dios. Final puxa para o dul√ßor alco√≥lico e especiarias.

3/20 tastes disgusting. Not like an IPA at all, more like a lambic. Very carbonated

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. Appearance: A hazy yellow with medium white head, which leaves some nice spots of lacing. Aroma:grapefruit, oranges, spices. Taste: light sweet, citrus hops, spices, some yeast. yeasty spicey bitter l light sweet fruity finish. Long bitter aftertaste. Average carbonation, medium body

Good Aroma, but overall less good as the aroma.

Lovely flavor and fragrance of flowers, fruitiness and sweetness. Good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth forever. Great beer. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
pours orange amber with a beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, sugar, caramel, yeasty, solid hoppy backing, some citric spices, medium body, bitter sweet malty finish.

33cl bottle from ales by mail I think. Light hazy dark gold to orange color. Medium white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Aroma and flavour is light alcohol, orange, hops, light yeast, pineapple, spices, pepper. Cool one.
Aroma is herbal and light citrusy. Taste is grassy and sharper citrus notes. Spice/herbs in the aftertaste. Really bitter finish that stays for quite a while. Not really my bag.

330ml bottle bought at Systembolaget, PK Huset. Noisy, pearl white head, crocheted lacing, near-clear warm golden body. Apricot and citrus on the nose. Mixed taste of spiced dried fruits, bread and yeast. Spiced bittersweet ending. Soft in the mouth. Fine bodied. Good drinking (Hotel room, Stockholm 24.11.2016).

Sample @HQ hiisi.
Pours cloudy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malts, yeast, fruits, hops. Flavor is mostly same.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy golden coloured with a massive head of white foam. It has a spicy citrus fruit flavour with floral notes and warming herbal spices on the smooth finish. Very good.

0,33L bottle bought at the Bottle Shop Hong Kong. 
Appearance: Pours a hazy golden colour with medium to tall foamy white head that lasts quite long.
Aroma: Herbal, grassy, Belgian yeast, some bready malt and orange/citrus peel. Mild tartness
Taste: Mild bitterness with light citrus, orange eel ad Belgian yeast. Some light woody and bready malt sweetness.
Palate: The carbonation is quite strong with medium prickly mouthfeel. Very subtle citrus and funky aftertaste.
Overall: Quite complex hoppiness (mainly orange peel and citrus) for a Belgian ale. Quite balanced too. However, it is certainly not the best beer from Buxton which may due to the freshness of the bottle.
Pour at Shelton Brothers. Yeasty hoppy goodness with nice creamy mouthfeel. Very nice.

On tap.
Pours a clear amber with full head.
Aromas of limes, pine, pineapple and light toasted malts.
Flavors of same with light Belgian spicy yeast. Subtle but well balanced.
Very Nice.

On tap @ What¬ís Brewing, Stavanger. Pours hazy golden, with a creamy head. Aroma is tart, wooden yeast, floral bretty notes and grassy notes. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is tart, wooden yeast, with hay, grassy notes and citrusy notes, as well light wood.

Bottled: July 20, 2016. Batch: 307. 

Orange, light hazy beer with a three finger high head. A lot of lacing stays on the glass.

Nose: Belgian yeast, banana, caramel, bread, malt and orange. 
Taste: Grass, caramel malt, citrus, orange and bread.
Mouth: Medium body. High carbonation. Pretty long finish with some sweetness medium bitterness.

Flaska fr√•n SB. B√§rnstensf√§rgad √•t orange, disig, medelh√∂gt vitt skum som l√§mnar mycket rester. Gr√§sig och √∂rtig smakprofil, tallskott och en ganska murrig j√§stton. Relativt s√∂t men tydlig beska balanserar den ganska bra. Saknar fruktighet och de fruktiga estrar jag f√∂rknippar med belgiska IPor. Ok.

Citrus, typisk belgisk j√§st, malt, s√∂tma, karamell, schysst beska. V√§ldigt trevlig!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden amber, tan head. Citrus nose, fruity esters, light malty, sweet notes, floral. Belgian yeast taste, grass, lemon, peach, grapefruit, light bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, bread, Belgian yeast, orange, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, Belgian yeast and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. A lot of orange for a Belgian Ale thanks to the hops. Amazingly balanced between these two styles.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy golden with a small head. 
Spicy, flowery, hoppy aroma. 
Belgian spiciness in the flavpur. Some sweet caramel along with dry, grassy hops.
Flaska fr√•n SB. Gul v√§tska med vitt skum. S√∂t doft av skumbanan. √Ñven smaken √§r typisk belgisk j√§st med skumbanan, inte mycket IPA √∂ver den, m√∂jligen lite mer beska.

Klar, orange-gul, orangeaktigt skum. Doft: Humle, skog, h√•rda frukt karameller, insj√∂ vatten, persika, s√∂t citrus, lite belgo blandat med nybakat kaffebr√∂d. Smak: Humle, belgo, blommigt-v√§xter, persika iste, gr√§s, citrus, tv√•l.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget


Clear orange colour with a big white head. Fruity, floral, sticky, easy going.
Hazy orange with offwhite head. Aromas of yeast, apricot, orangezest and grass. Taste is pretty much the same with some caramell and a nice dry bitter finish.

0.33 bottle.   A hazy, gold color and a huge white head. Aroma of Belgian yeasts, spices, some hops, and cloves. Taste is sweet, yeasty, spicy, with a delicate hop presence - certainly not bad and probably a good switch from the overly cloy character some Belgian ales can have. A full body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is medium long and relatively bitter, though not to a fault. Overall the beer is pleasant and a bit different from the usual, sweet, Belgian brews.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, orange zest and grassy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Belgian IPA indeed. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Bottled 14JAN16. BB 14JAN17. Colour is very cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, some sweetness, some ripe fruits, Belgian yeast, some hops and malts.
Clear, dark golden. Big white head. Yeasty aroma, fruity and caramely. Sweet flavour, yeast, dark citrus and floral honey. Slightly spicy finish. Well balanced and lovely.

330ml bottle. Clear dark golden with one finger white head. Initially very fruity aroma with citrus, orange, mango and light grapefruit going increasingly towards Belgo yeast and a light spiciness. Taste has the same fruitiness with citrus, orange, light grapefruit, light floweiness and some grapefruit as well as Belgo yeast, spices, clove and an almost burnt malt note. Medium mouthfeel, strong carbonation and dry yeast aftertaste with a touch of refreshing citrus.

Pours hazy amber with high white head 
Aromas of spices, belgo yeast, caramel, tropical fruits 
Taste has sweet notes of spices, tea, tropical fruits, caramel, bread

Flaska fr√•n SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, belgisk j√§st, ljus torkad frukt, karamell, aprikos med toner av √∂rter och honung. Kryddig och pepprig, s√∂t och fruktig, rund och len, fin beska med smak av citrus. Hade nog tj√§nat p√• att lagras n√•got √•r.

Bottle from Systembolaget, thanks to Joakim. Hazy golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy yeasty aroma, pine, yeast, spicy, floral notes, some peach and caramel. Hoppy yeasty flavor, citrus, hay, grapes, floral, slightly herbal. Quite nice.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear amber, medium white head. Bready malt, orangey tangerine hop, some peppery phenols. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.
33 cl bottle from SB. Bubblegum, mandarins, grass. Great aroma. Great taste. Herbal, fruity.

Bottle from Skelly¬ís, Ballymahon [200816]
Amber, hazy, rich flully white head
Aroma of yeast, soft sweet fruits, bit spicy, light farmyard, aroma eventually dissipates to a dullish bit soapy nose
Taste of spicy yeat, fairly bitter hops, peppery belgian yeast, sweet malt background, quite complex, tasty
Palate - Medium carb, medium to full body, quite sweet. Finish is soft bitter, gets more bitter and spicy with the drinking
Overall - I¬íve always like these belgian yeast IPAs - it¬ís a combo that usually works well
Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden. Big and lasting white head over a light copper beer. Fresh flower-citrus hop aroma. Distinct bitterness and big hop taste. Fresh taste and medium body.
@ Basunen 16-8-27: ganska tydlig brett och funk i smaken. Mycket belgisk men √§ven tydlig humlig med en lite str√§v eftersmak.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 @ Kristoffers v√§g 26/8-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and yeasty with notes of spices. Body is medium, the finish is is dry, fruity and yeasty with spicy notes.
@ Havregatan 20160826. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and yeasty, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and yeasty.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Light golden colour, slightly hazy, thick white foam. Really nice this, complex with crisp malts, dry, yeasty esters but not cloying, and a prickly spicy slightly citrusy hop bitterness. Drinks really nicely, lovely.
Bottle from SB. Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Fruity and spicy tones. Fruit, malt, spices and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter/ spicy finish.
Clear golden yellow color, large white head. Fresh pine hops, some yeast and a sweet, fruity aroma. Taste of hops, hay, citrus, fruit and some herbs. Sweet with a bitter finish.
Ljusorange, l√§tt disig v√§tska med vitt skum. Lite belgotoner, gr√∂nt √§pple och p√§ron. N√•got l√§ttare kropp. √Ñpple inledningsvis, tillsammans med lite s√∂tare belgotoner. Ganska markerad beska.

Bottle from local SB Majorna cons 2016-08-20 G√∂teborg, 
AR: tropical fruity, citrus zest
AP: clear amber, high frothy cream ofwhite foam
F: bitter, wee belgian yeasty, caramel, citrus zest, white grapes, rich carbonation, bitter *, dry finish
earthy, bread, resin, floral, citrus, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively, bitter, solid
330ml Bottle - Amber in colour. Peach, lychees, syrup and a hint of banana in the aroma. Peach, banana, lemon, sultanas, caramel and some earthy notes in the taste.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Bottled 33cl. Color : hazy golden ale with scattered white head. Nose : citrus, exotic fruits, floral hops. Aromas : lychee, citrus, mango. Very nice bitterness, low carbonation, dry texture.

Pours a hazy yellow with medium white head. Nose is . Aromas are tropical fruits, grapefruit, spices and butter notes. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter, sweet and spicy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a light amber colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with Belgien yeast and some caramel. Dry finish
Kick 030516. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is yeast, malt, hop, sugar. Flavour is sweet, yeast, malt, hop, sugar, fruit, pine, oranges, peaches. Full body. Nice beer.

Keg at the Northern Craft Beers Festival at the Hawkshead Brewery. Hazy golden with a big foamy head and plenty of bubbles. Mild citrus yest aroma. The taste is citrus, bread and yeast with a pleasant bitter finish. Very drinkable. Nice.

On tap at Cafe Sara, march 23rd 2016. Hazy golden body with a thick white head. Aroma of tropical hops, mild yeast esters of the spicy kind, taste is dry and crisp, citric with peach, and pine, with a pleasant belgian yeast finish and a light funky fruit aftertaste. Quite good!

Bottle. Amber coloured beer with a strong head. The aroma is lightly spiced, and the flavour is very bitter with a spiced nature and some roasted maltiness. Overall a nice Belgian style beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at BD Clerkenwell. Pours hazy gold , lacy head. Spice, banana, something damp on the nose. First mouthful was sharp and fizzy and a bit strange. It settles down to a yeasty, fruity, bitter and refreshing beer. Somewhere between Saison and IPA. Kinda like it, but it¬ís probably a one off.

Pours a slightly cloudy orange to amber. High carbonation and fluffy white head.

Aroma is rich and yeasty. Orange, cloves, toffee, lemon peel and grass. Taste is sweet, spicy, bordering a light saison, with a touch sour bitter finish.

Decent stuff.
Bottle. Golden color. Pours a huge head. Soft herbal aroma. malty yet dry herbal hopbitter flavor. Soft grassy notes, especially in the finish. Characterful beer.

Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Fruity smell and taste with a spicy yeasty aroma. Similar taste. Some light herbal hops. More belgian ale then IPA. 

Fruktig doft och smak och s√• d√§r j√§stigt kryddigt som m√•nga belgare √§r. Men vart √§r humlen? Jag hittar bara en l√§ttare √∂rtig humlearom. Mer belgare √§n IPA. Klart drickbar dock.

33 cl bottle. Bottled 19.02.2016. BBE 19.02.2017.
Pours hazy golden color with a large white head. Sweet apricot on the nose, some spices with yeast and earthy notes. Flavor is sweet with ripe fruits and caramel, mild sugary toffee sweetness, subtle yeast and very distant hops. Carbonation is a bit on the strong side but fits the style. Slightly too sweet but a decent interpretation of the style with a hop twist, which is barely present in the end.
5334

Draft @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy weak yeasty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty citrus hoppy finish.
Aroma: pineapple, lemon, various tropical fruit juice, aabolinsh. Taste: salds kartupelis ar ananasu un mazliet pljavaa pluuktas pukju saujinjas. Labs bet pasalds

On tap at Fermentoren. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma is malty, fruit, hops, grass, yeast and slight spice. Taste is malty, slight alcohol, hops, yeast, grass, spice, orange and hay. Nicely balanced.
Bottle at home. Belgian yeast funk nose with mild sweetness. Orange and grapefruit. Moderate bitter finish. Tasty.

Brown bottle, 330ml. Pours medium dark amber brown with a thin white head subsiding average. Scent is medium dense IPA with flowers and honey. Taste is light gose hints and a bit of sourness. Finish is a little dry and dirty. Very good. Great.

Tap @ Fermentoren, CPH. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, hop and spices. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, spices, orange peel, sweet, hop, medium sweet, grass and medium bitter.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Aroma of citrus, banana, mango and pine. Taste is fruity with sweet and a touch of bitterness. It did seem like a belgian blonde/IPA hybrid to me so did what it was meant to.

33cl bottle from Sip, Tallinn. Pours hazy deep golden to orange with a decent, white head, Fruity aroma, Belgian yeast, mild citrus, some tropical fruits and hints of spices. Moderate to medium sweet with nice blend of traditional Belgian flavours and the more hoppy ones. Smooth, tasty and dangerously drinkable.

0.33 l bottle from ?Saveur Bi√®re?, bottled in January 2016. Clear, golden amber with a large, dense, stable, off-white head. Sweetish-fruity, a bit grassy and slightly spicy aroma of mango, orange peel, caramel, some honey and a bit of pine. Sweetish-fruity, a little grassy and slightly spicy taste of mango, caramel, orange peel, honey and some pine, followed by a medium long, rather dry-bitter, slightly resiny, spicy finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really nice, combines the characteristics of both worlds convincingly.

Sweet malty aroma and taste, sugar, caramel, yeasty, solid hoppy backing, some citric spices, medium body, bitter sweet malty finish.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeasty, fruity hops, bitter citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is light sweet, rather bitter, malt, yeasty, bitter citrusly hops, grapefruit. Medium body, average carbonation light bitter finish. 120516
Pours slightly cloudy amber worth reasonable head . Lovely strong citrus aroma. Strong hoppy bitterness that lasts. However I found it over fizzy, which spoiled it slightly.

Bottle. Golden yellow colour. Mexium white head. Fruity, bit grassy, slightly caramelly, slightly sweet aroma. Hints of flowers, hints of caramel at first. Citrussy in the middle. Flowery finish. Fruity aftertaste. Really well balanced, rather light bodied, well drinkable beer.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty, fruity and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 120516
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is malty and hoppy, slightly spicy. Taate is spicy, i get a red wine barrel flavour too.
From tap at Fermentoren. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, yeast, hops, fruit, caramel and bitterness.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy, grapefruity and slight grainy. Sweet, fruity, crisp hoppy. Mellow yeasty. Light fruity, slight bitter and mellow fruity finish.
Draft. A hazy amber beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, malt, and Belgisk yeast. The flavor is sweet with notes of fruits, malt, and yeast, leading to a bitter finish.

Tap @ Keller, Tartu. Pours golden, quite clear with big and long-lasting white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, hops, light sweetness, yeast, mango, pineapple, little bit sweaty shirt. Fresh aroma. Taste is strongly fruity, some bitter notes in side, little bit raw apple, mango, a lot of citrus. In the end hops together with yeast reveal themselves. Nicely balanced!

Keg at The Buxton Tap House. A slightly hazy deep golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of orange peel, grapefruit, some lemon, subtle yeast and slight herbal hops. Taste of orange, grapefruit, some pine, slight lemon, a little caramel and subtle herbal hops. Medium bodied and a slightly oily texture. A dry, lingering, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Don¬ít get any of the Belgian yeast in the taste, just like a standard IPA overall. It¬ís good but just slightly disappointed.

Aroma: yeast, sweet citrus fruits, sweet orange, tangerine, light floral hops. Appearance: dark, hazy gold, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweet grain malts, yeast, light citrus fruits, grapefruit, orange peel, turns quite bitter and dry in the finish. Overall: fantastic Belgian Ale, very complex (and delicious) in both aroma and palate. Bottle from brewery (via Eebria), Buxton.

33cl bottle at home from thebeershop-online.com. Nose is fruity, slightly citric. Body is hazy orange, head is very big, white, rocky, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is fruity, grass, citric, leaves, honey. Medium sweet, light bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is long lasting fruity hoppy medium bittersweet, further developing hoppy bitterness, later also light salty and umami. Medium body, soapy texture, lively carbonation. Flavourful fruity beer, very tasty, one of the best belgian ales I¬íve ever drunk.
Pours cloudy orange with a huge and foamy white head. Aroma is citrus and coriander. Taste: citrus zest, coriander, spicy. banana. Creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 Keg (Angleterre, Helsinki)
Pleasant spicy aroma. Balance between yeast aspects and malt very pleasant. Sweetish, but not sticky. Hoppy but not aggressive. Interesting finish, spicy, and almost a chilli bite. Do like it. Hooray for accidental rerates (and down with backlogs). Covers 6.8% very well, drinkability very high.
Rerate of: Tap (TCBW2016) (5:3:4:3:10=2.5)
Sweet and sticky. Belgian yeast is dirty. Narp. This keg seems to have not settled properly.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet, on order. Clear deep golden color, good foam. Medium high aroma intensity; hops, pine, fruitiness and good yeast influence. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Very enjoyable
Tap at TCBW. Pours golden-yellow. Aroma is fruity, mano. Flavor is sour, citrus, lemon. Overall: ok-ish.

22nd March 2016Lightly hazy gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and a little dry. Good fine carbonation. A savoury nutty creamy malt sweetness. Minerals, seltzer. Modest lemony citrus, mild pine. Light dry crisp finish. Tasty enough but doesn¬ít warrant it¬ís boast of being an IPA Anglo, Belgian or otherwise.

Keg @ Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Hazy golden, long lasting and rich lacing white head. Hoppy aroma, citrus, banana and yeast. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Great taste of Belgo yeast and fruit, banana, pear and bitter citrus notes, zest and grapefruit.

Tap @TCBW 2016. Clear amber color. Alcohol, banana, yeasty, floral, sweet and woody in aroma. Banana, citrus, fruity, raisins, sweet and woody in taste. Sweet malts and delicate hops in aftertaste. Mellow mouthfeel. Pleasant and drinkable. Excellent brew.
Tap, TCBW ¬í16. Fresh juicy aroma/taste with white grapes and tangerines, I don¬ít really detect the Belgian yeast. Good, but It¬ís closer to an IPA than a Belgian Ale.

Keg at Pressklubben, Stockholm.  Cloudy deep golden, small head. Rich grassy citrusy nose with kumquat and passionfruit. Mid dry with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Spices, grass and tangerine. Long bitter finish. Really nice Belgo IPA.

Bought and consumed in April 2016. 

AROMA: Clean barnyard, if that makes sense? Fresh smell of Light sweet wheat.Something I can¬ít put my finger on but it¬ís good. 

APPEARANCE: Large head dissapates into thin edge ring. Turbid, Deep amber body with a blonde hue under light. 

TASTE: It tastes wheaty, underlying bananas, (Perle hops?), there¬ís a sort of pleasantness in this again which I find hard to describe. It¬ís lovely. 

PALATE: Quite lingering and moreish. Medium body and carbonation. Very, very VERY slight tart edge.

OVERALL: Fantastic beer. Enjoyed it a lot.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Aroma is vanilla, banana, orange, lemon and belgium yeast. Full body and very tasty balance between hoppiness and the yeast. Interesting brew that i really enjoyed.
Tap at TCBW. Nose is fruity, bubblegum, malt, peaches, mango. Flavor is grassy hops, slightly sour malt, caramel and buttery notes, mango. Hops in the finish

Bottle. Nose is lime, grass, yeast, a little musty, white grape, hint of apple. Taste is dry, grape, lime and grapefruit, hint of orange, a little honey/toffee, grass, Belgian yeast, hay, leading to a dry herbal spice and bitter finish.

A very nice beer, but the Belgian series beer I enjoyed the least.

Bottle shared at Leightons place 21/03/2016. Many thanks to Colin for this one. Translucent golden orange coloured pour with a lasting loose white head. Aroma is nice orange peel, tropical fruit, mango, hint peppercorn, hint of petrol. Flavour is composed of wheat, orange rind, pithy lemon, hint of Belgian yeast, straw, spicy citrus hop. Palate is medium light, frothy airy carbonation, Refreshing. Belgian yeast is well integrated with the hops. Solid,.

Bottle share at Leighton¬ís, thanks to Colin. As ¬íBuxton Anglo-Belgique¬í, 6.8%. Vibrant orange, hazy and opaque, foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is pine, sherbet, wine gums, some lavender. Body is light, foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is toffee, yeasty, earth and citrus, lightly floral. Looks and smells great but doesn¬ít quite deliver at the business end. Very good overall though.

33cl bottle from Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean rich golden color with a large white head. Aroma is yeasty and sweet, with notes of caramel, Belgian yeast, bubble gum and booze. Taste is also heavy, a bit boozy, sweet and malty / yeasty with notes of bubble gum caramel banana esters and light bitter pine cones and ripe stone fruit. Finishes dry and estery spicy. Warming. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, a bit rough

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Colin. Pours lightly hazy gold with a creamy, white head. Great aroma, nice Belgian yeast, juicy tangerine, orange, grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor with pale bready malts, spicy yeast, pithy grapefruit, citrus peel. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly warming on the finish, with some bitter pine, grapefruit, tangerine, pale bread, Belgian yeast. Excellent stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 Bottle thanks to Colin. It pours hazy orange with a thick white head. The aroma is fresh, orange, tangerine, apricot, orange sherbet, orange blossom and Tropicana. The taste is crisp, bitter, bready, orange peel, tropical fruits, tangerine, light alcohol, bready maltage and some alcohol to keep it in check with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well rounded, fruity and tastee.

Bottle split at Bespin, from Beer Gonzo, 21/03/16.
Hazed orange golden with a decent off White covering 
Nose is juicy tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, orange wine gums, light peppery spice. 
Taste comprises jammy citrics, pineapple, orange peel, light yeast, bread malts, sweet licks. 
Solid juicy Belgo #.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours clear golden with a creamy white head. Aromas of peach, pineapple, apricot, citrus, tropical fruit jam, esters. Taste is very fruity with some honey-like sweetness and moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Hazy deep golden colour with a white head. Aroma tropical fruity, yeast and citrus fruit. Taste starts light sweet, with a citrus bitter finish.

Misty golden body, grey head. Interesting mix between fruity yeast and citrus hops. Lovely rich aroma, yellow fruit, bitter grapefruit peel. Super juicy taste, great stuff. One of the best Belgian IPAs I¬íve tasted. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bi√®re)

33cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle sweet tones. Citrus, grapefruit, orange, malts, caramel and spices. Very good.

A dark yellow beer, strong bubbling, a head is big and blond. Aroma has lots of fruitness that has notes both of hops and yeast, tropical fruits, smooth mangos, gooseberries, black currants, lime, some spicyness. Fresh and great aroma. Taste has also complex fruitness, mangos and citrusfruits, black currants, nice and medium bitterness, some spicyness that¬ís getting stronger in the end. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, refreshning. The great beer with the complex fruitness. I like this kind of thinking about the beers.

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours slightly hazy golden-amber. Nose is citrus, fresh hops, light spices and yeast. Taste is bittersweet, hoppy, citrus, yeast, finish is long dryish bitterish and light spices. Quite multi-dimensional. These hybrids are interesting and this is one of the best ones, really fits my taste.
Hazy golden with white head. Grapefruit, spice, mango and light caramel. Dry, hoppy, green and light spicy alcoholic finish. Overall: good! Very balanced and refined.
Bottle at home, 10th March 16. Aroma is pine, yeast, bitter citrus hops. Taste is pine hops, good Belgian yeast, slick mouth feel, bitter citrus finish

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat.Pours clear deep golden with a big creamy white head. Fresh fruity aroma, some piney hops. Taste is smooth, yet crisp fruity hops, belgian fresh yeasty notes with oranges and apricot bitterness at the lingering finish, nice.
From bottle at Cornelius. Pours hazy gold. Nose of mango, apricot, hay, sweet malts. Citrus fruit on the palate, nice full body. Long, dry finish.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy orange body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of blood orange, lime and white bread. Flavour of juicy hops, lemon, yeast and sweet orange. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Tangy and dry - very nice.
Bottle from beerhive. Hazy pale gold, white head. Belgian yeast, esters, hops. Tingly lips. Medium full body soft fizz. More yeast and lemon. Smooth bitter finish. Classy as always.

bottle at home from Cotteridgehazy amber, pillowy cream head, big fruity yeast esters and tropical hopsplosion on nose. Full bodied, fruity, plenty bitter but good malt foil and mouthfeel to carry it well - could be my favourite hop-forward Belgian yeasted beer to date, extremely drinkable, low pith, excellent balance yet still punchy. Fab work Colin, Denis and co.

Tr√®s bien nomm√©e puisque l¬íon est effectivement ici entre deux mondes, mais avec une classe certaine ... Comment pourrait-il en √™tre autrement avec Buxton ?! J¬íen boirais pas non plus tout les jours ...

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear burnished amber pour with a creamy off white head, aroma has yeast, tangerine and a hint of pine, taste has grapefruit, tangerine, some caramel, a hint of lemon, nice drop.

Bottle. Eebria. Gold, with a soft haze. Thin, messy, lasting, white head. Lots of tangy hop. Gooseberry. Pink grapefruit. Some white grape. Lots of fruity esters, too. Cracker biscuit, and ripe banana. Smells good. Taste is fruity, estery sweet. Light hop bitterness. Smooth, foamy mouthfeel. Some richness to it. Rising, lasting hop bitterness on the finish. Very nice. I¬íll look forward to trying the rest of the set...
Pours murky orange with a big foamy head. A lovely banana, Belgian yeast aroma. A nice spiciness, an extremely interesting bitterness too. An interesting beer.

330ml bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours clear gold, thin white head. Aroma is lightly sweet yeast. Taste is beautifully smooth and sweet with good Belgian yeast and peach / melon / apricot fruitiness shining through. This is a good Belgian blonde.

Bottle courtesy of Bobinlondon (cheers Bob and btw it was great to see and catch up with you) at Merton Beer Festival, Saturday 27th February 2016   Wonderful clean spritzy nose, hazy gold, warmth, busy carbonation, lots of hoppy burps, a big surge of late bitterness. This is soft in the MouthI love the stingy hoppiness, more hoppy than many of this ilk, really good, perhaps my favourite of this series so far.  A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov15 3.9

Bottle. at Clayton¬ís. 

Lots of Christmas cake. Saison flavours. Rye malt. Dough. Caramel. A little hot. Pine. Resinous. Clean. Really well made

Bottle thanks to Bob in London. Clear gold lasting white head. Esters and hops on aroma. Peach aroma. Definitely Belgian yeast. Peach apricot. Big hops as well. As a Belgium ipa it¬ís pretty good. Decent.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours clear golden with a thick rapidly diminishing white head. Complex Belgian yeast & hop aroma , candy sugar ,fresh bread & tangerine ,. Taste is hoppy more tangerine plus piney hop ,more Belgian yeast flavours ,candy sugar & bread along with good bitterness & some dryness , the finish is hoppy,spicy  ,bitter & Savoury. A really good interesting beer,blending Belgian techniques with a really good IPA.
Pours from the bottle a slightly hazy orange, with a nice foam head. Tangerine hops fill the aroma, with the Belgian yeast giving a spicy finish. Very good

Bottle. Pours a clearish golden orange with a fading off white bubbly head. Aroma of oranges, mango, passion fruit, caramel, bread, yeast notes. Taste is of oranges, mango, melon, light spice notes, bread. Juicy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: high grasssy hops domiantion. Floral notes and citrus. Taste: medium body with good malt and balanced with citrus/grassy hops. Maybe too lemonish taste for a Belgium style beer.... Good attenuation with nice malt and hoppy taste. Aftertaste: lime and grassy.

Malty, bit spicy,bit flat, cardboardy ol buttery malty nose, old hay. Med full bodied, bitters, straw/hay malty. Orange zests, dry orange, dried stone fruits. Lots of flavours, but,after that super tart, refreshing one this feels a bit stale papery. Perfectly ok tho.-- bb
Keg at the hanging bat... Golden amber... Soft sweet zezty.. Floral fruits.. Juicy lemon zezt nose... Banana.. Floral zezty fruits.. Too fizzy.. Little Wierd .. Light bready Finnish
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours pale golden orange, nose is sweet toffee, yeasty, citrus, taste is dry, grapefruit, sweet.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of yeasty esters, floral hops. Taste is light bitter, some lemon, some woodiness. Smooth finish, easy drinking.
